title: Manasa
summary: Manasa is a Hindu goddess of snakes, worshipped mainly in Bengal, Jharkhand, other parts of northeastern India and in Uttarakhand chiefly for the prevention and cure of snakebite and also for fertility and prosperity. Manasa is the sister of Vasuki, king of Nāgas (snakes) and wife of sage Jaratkaru. She is also the mother of the sage Astika.[1] She is also known as Vishahara (the destroyer of poison), Nityā (eternal) and Padmavati.[2]
